result.execSummary:
The defendant Kolten W Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kolten W Wilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kolten W Wilson was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.
Court finds defendant eligible for expunction under 973.015 successful completion of probation, no ATR's or no new charges.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Concur to all other cases. Stayed upon acceptance into residential treatment. Credit does NOT apply.

supervisions.notes: Without huber. Concur to 15CF327.  Sentence deemed served.

Withdrawn per TM, COC.

Bail Amended:  
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant has been referred to the Drug Court Diversion Program
